intro: Sebastiania corniculata var. laeta, commonly known as the golden-seeded sebastiania, is a species of flowering plant in the Euphorbiaceae family. It is native to parts of Central and South America, where it typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its most distinctive feature is the production of bright orange or red, fleshy fruits that contain numerous seeds. The plant is often cultivated as an ornamental due to its attractive foliage and unique fruiting structures.
